Microtubule Catastrophe

People| Code|

Rashi Jeeda, Joeyta Banerjee, Mei Yi You

Abstract

Microtubules are cellular filaments that play key roles in important cell processes, most prominently cell division. They are composed of several monomeric units and undergo periods of growth and shortening; the conversion from growth to shortening is known as catatrophe. The dynamics of catastrophe were measured by Gardner et. al. We find that there is little difference in catastrophe dynamics for GFP-labeled tubulin and non-labeled tubulin, and conclude that an exponential model best describes catastrophe dynamics. We will discuss satistical methods used for the analysis of this data.
